name: Amulet
description: An amulet that bears the symbol of a deity or other powerful otherworldly creature.

name: Censer
description: An incense burner, often carried on a rope or chain.  Incense in a censer can be ignited using a tinderbox as an action, and burns for 1 hour.

name: Chalice
description: A bejeweled goblet made of precious metals, often filled with wine or potions.

name: Component Pouch
description: A small pouch, which contains a variety of magical components.

name: Crystal
description: A crystal imbued with arcane energy.

name: Emblem
description: The symbol of a patron deity emblazoned on a shield or suit of armor.

name: Mistletoe
description: A small sprig of mistletoe, which druids can focus magic through.

name: Orb
description: An orb with arcane energy, sometimes in the form of a crystal ball.

name: Reliquary
description: A small box used for containing holy relics.

name: Ritual Knife
description: A small knife, often made of obsidian or glass, that is used in occult rituals for drawing blood or sacrifices.

name: Rod
description: A medium-length rod of wood capped with metal endcaps.

name: Spirit Lantern
description: A lantern that encases a small spirit such as a will-o-wisp, causing it to shed bright light in a 20 foot radius, and dim light 20 feet beyond that.

name: Staff
description: A long length of wood used to focus magical spells.  A staff can be used as a quarterstaff.

name: Totem
description: A totem, carved from wood or bone, that depicts nature spirits, animals, or primeval deities.

name: Wand
description: A short length of wood used to focus magic.
